Gloss Boost 125ml

Gloss Boost™ is the world's best after-wash gloss enhancer, very quickly and very easily boosting the gloss and reflectivity of any high gloss surface such as paintwork, glass or chrome.

Gloss Boost™ is safe on all exterior surfaces including uncoated plastics. Gloss Boost™ also provides lubrication for safer removal of very light debris such as dust and fingerprints.

Gloss Boost™ has 1% nano-polymers for a small amount of protection.

Also fantastic on interior surfaces such as glossy interior trim, transparent plastics such as instrument cluster covers and TV/Navigation screens, headlights, tail lights -anything that isn't leather, plastic, fabric or vinyl.

Directions

  1. Apply Gloss Boost™ to a clean and dry vehicle.
  2. Spray a few pumps* of Gloss Boost™ onto a clean and dry NanoFibre Paintwork Cloth™.
  3. Working one panel at a time, wipe any paint, glass and chrome turning cloth until a high gloss is achieved.

Interior Cleanse 500ml

A professional strength, citrus-based Interior Cleanser with fast oil-breaking characteristics. Quick cleaning, low-foaming, pleasant smelling and safe for use on all types of plastic, vinyl and fabric. Interior Cleanse can be used to remove stains, oils, make-up and general dirt and debris from all surfaces quickly and easily. Yellow 'Interior Cleaning' colour coding.

Please Note: Leather Clean Gel is recommended for cleaning leather surfaces

Directions

  1. For best results, spray a few pumps of Interior Clenase™ onto a slightly damp Final Inspection NanoFibre Interior Cloth™

Jaffa (General Purpose Cleaner) 500ml

Jaffa Citrus Degreaser delivers fast and perfect results whilst extra safe on all exterior materials

Jaffa is a citrus-based, high foaming and long dwelling general purpose degreaser/cleaner for removing bugs and general dirt and grime from exterior surfaces as well as wheel arches, engine bays and wheels themselves.

Clean tyre treads for shows for the new tyre look. Clean tyre sidewalls to remove old dressing and allow new dressing to pentrate, reducing slinging.

Directions

  1. For best results, spray a few pumps of Jaffa™ onto an area of a wet vehicle such as front bumper bar to remove bugs
  2. Allow product to dwell but not dry, never allow Jaffa to dry. Agitate if necessary.
  3. Rinse (high pressure recommended) to remove debris such as bugs and wash vehicle as usual.

Clay Lube 500ml

Clay Lube provides Suspending & Lubricating protection during the claying process.

It minimises contact with the paint surface which minimises marring whilst allowing the Clay bar to capture contaminants sitting above the surface. Clay Lube also lightly cleans the surface and helps to keep clay bars clean and soft/pliable.

Directions

It is important to soak your cloths in water with a little peppermint immediately after use. Especially after using Microfibre or NanoFibre with products that will harden around fibres such as sealants and waxes, it is extrememly importnat to immediately soak your cloths in a solution of (preferably warm) water and Peppermint to stop the waxes from bonding to the fibres.

Final Inspection recommend preparing a bucket of 5-15Litres of water (depending on how many cloths will be soaked) with 2-6 caps of Peppermint disolved in it before starting any detailing work and saturating and soaking cloths as soon as possible after use, especially with waxes before washing. Clothes can be soaked overnight. This process will significantly assist in avoiding hardening fibres.

  1. Clay can ONLY be used on Paintwork, Glass & Chrome.
  2. Surfaces must be clean before use. We highly recommend thoroughly washing entire vehicle directly prior to decontaminating surfaces with Clay.
  3. Mist panel thoroughly with Lubricant and mist Clay also. Don’t under use Clay Lube to avoid dry-rubbing and subsequent marring.
  4. Work 1 panel at a time and immediately remove Lube with a Nanofibre Paintwork Cloth. Only Clay panels that are cool to touch to avoid Lubricant drying onto surface. Mist inside of Clay Box to help stop Clay Bar from sticking to internal storage surfaces.

IMPORTANT

Clay must be discarded if dropped onto ground or placed on a dirty surface. To avoid having to discard entire clay bar if dropped, dissect into smaller pieces prior to use. Clay should be rested on a clean cloth or in its’ storage box when not in use.

Directions: Alternate Method

Peppermint NanoFibre Wash 500ml

The best way to care for your high quality cloths is with Peppermint, the product designed to remove debris and stains quickly and efficiently from delicate fibres.

Peppermint cleans without fabric softeners (which ruin NanoFibre and Microfibre), Peppermint has microbial (anti-bacterial) ingredients which assist to inhibit mould/mold growth and odours.

Recommended Use

  1. Spray directly onto cloths as a pre-soak immediately before washing
  2. As a washing detergent for Microfibre and NanoFibre
  3. As a soaking agent between use and wash for microfibre or NanoFibre products.

Directions

It is important to soak your cloths in water with a little peppermint immediately after use. Especially after using Microfibre or NanoFibre with products that will harden around fibres such as sealants and waxes, it is extrememly importnat to immediately soak your cloths in a solution of (preferably warm) water and Peppermint to stop the waxes from bonding to the fibres.

Final Inspection recommend preparing a bucket of 5-15Litres of water (depending on how many cloths will be soaked) with 2-6 caps of Peppermint disolved in it before starting any detailing work and saturating and soaking cloths as soon as possible after use, especially with waxes before washing. Clothes can be soaked overnight. This process will significantly assist in avoiding hardening fibres.

  1. Never use fabric softeners to condition NanoFibre (& Microfibre) Cloths.
  2. Never wash NanoFibre (& Microfibre) at water temps higher than 55deg C.
  3. 'Spot' Stains by spraying Peppermint Wash directly onto NanoFibre (& Microfibre) and allowing no more than 5 min dwelling time prior to washing. Do not allow Peppermint to dry on cloths.
  4. Peppermint is very concentrated. 1 Cap (20ml) of Peppermint Wash cleans up to 40 Cloths.
  5. Do not overuse Peppermint by highly concentrating.

NanoFibre Care

Care of all microfibre and nanofibre products involves removal of dirt and debris as soon as possible with gentle cleaners. Final Inspection recommend 'Peppermint' anti-bacterial nanofibre wash solution, using no more than 60deg water temperature.

Also known as 'Truth Serum', Paint Cleanse is designed to remove all traces of polish residue and any other oils and waxes from hard surfaces, specifically, paintwork, glass and chrome and allows detailers to see exactly what imperfections (if any) still require correction.

Purity (Anti-bacterical Interior Cleaner) 500ml

Purity is a bactericidal, virucidal, fungacidal and sanitising agent designed to eliminate germs from all Interior surfaces in your car leaving is significantly cleaner than what most interior cleaning products alone can achieve.

Purity is designed to bring bacteria levels down to a much safer level and recommended to be used to remove chemical residue from interior cleaners and when passengers are experiencing sickness.

Purity works by hindering microbial activity, more specifically, a bacterial cell's capability to reproduce.

Directions

USE IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA, do not use Purity in a cabin with closed doors.

Spray 4-6 pumps of Purity onto a clean (not used for any other purpose or with any chemical) NanoFibre Interior Cloth and wipe surfaces leaving them wet for at least 30 seconds. Remove purity from the surface with either the dry side of the cloth or a separate clean, dry NanoFibre Interior Cloth.

IMPORTANT: Surfaces must remain wet for 30 seconds for Purity to work. If surfaces do not stay wet for more than 30 seconds, add more Purity to cloth and repeat.

For hard surface and transparent plastics, if streaking remains, re apply a very small amount of product to dry cloth and remove immediately (no wetting time) for a streak free finish.

For higher gloss on wood trim and other high gloss surfaces, we recommend applying a very small amount of Gloss Boost.

Purity is a colourless, almost odourless liquid.

Purity is 100% Australian Made.

Purify and clarify any painted or glass surfaces by removing tar, adhesives and light sub-surface contamination with this thorough chemical paint cleanser, best used directly after mechanical decontamination (claying).

Designed primarily to quickly and efficiently remove oils & tar from paintwork, Cleanse STRONG™ will safely remove the majority of surface and sub-surface contaminants from paint, glass, wheels and chrome.

Directions

Denim

Denim OPR pads reduce orange peel texture of the paint surface by removing film build from the tops of the 'hills' that are the make-up of the 'hill and valley' orange peel texture.

Denim pads are the equivalent to 2ooo grit abrasive sanding discs and whilst use of these pads doesn't result in the marred surface you expect from a 2ooo grit sanding disc, the film build removal is as aggressive.

Unlike sanding paper or discs, OPR pads allow for gradual texture correction in a far more prgressive manner, blending texture with OPR pads is a much more forgiving experience.

Velvet OPR pads are for skilled and experienced professionals or advanced amateurs only as they are deceivingly aggressive and do remove a substantial amount of film build, very quickly.

Directions

  1. Make sure panels to be texture corrected are clean, dry and free of surface contaminants, decontamination is essential for efficient OPR. It is highly recommended to diagnose surfaces for sufficient film build with an accurate and properly calibrated PTT.
  2. Centre your OPR pad to your backing plate and use a slow speed with a small amount of polish to correct surface as you would if you were to polish with a foam or NanoFibre pad. Final Inspection recommend CAP Heavy with OPR pads but you will be able to utilise any C.A.P polish.
  3. Remove polish with a NanoFibre Paintwork Cloth and Paint Cleanse and check surface for texture correction.

Please Note:

  • If correction levels are yet to be reached, repeat step 2 and 3.
  • If correction levels are not ample with Velvet pads, we recommend a Denim OPR pad.
  • It is recommended to check film build levels with a PTT after texture correction for documentation.
  • An interface pad may be used (between OPR pad and backing plate) for varied correction characteristics.

NanoFibre Wash Mitt

Part of the quickest, easiest and most comfortable washing experience.

All new for 2013, the NanoFibre 'Curvy Lady' Wash Mitt is part of, arguably, the most important part of exterior maintaince.

With it's generous and comfortable shape and size, this tailored moquet weave mitt will gently but effectively and efficiently remove weekly build-up of temporary contaminants from your vehicles surfaces.

Why NanoFibre?

Unlike a sponge, a NanoFibre? Mitt is properly machine washable, making it a much safer alternative.

Why?

Sponges have thousands or millions of cells that catch and harbour debris and that debris is re-intoruced to your surface with every wash, along with ever increasing marring as the sponge fills with swirl inducing particles. The plastic used to make foam is also agreessive and creates additional marring, so even from the very first wipe, a NanoFibre Mitt is protecting your surfaces.

Performance

The Curvy Lady with its loose 'open end' NanoFibre? will efficiently release debris when washed. The mitt is constructed with the highest quality so you can regularly clean the mitt during washes with your high pressure water unit or mains pressure water without damaging your curvy lady.

The Curvy Lady has an astonishing amount of the smallest multi-split nanofibre packed together to reach 600 gsm making it super absorbant and incredibly effecive at extracting and holding large amounts of fine debris and oils. Recommended for use on all exterior surfaces such as paint, glass and plastics and even fabric soft tops.

The NanoFibre Wash Mitt features robust hand sewn polyester overlocking which is completely concealed inside the mitt.

Directions

Use the moquet weave wash mitt with the wash method developed by our in-house detailers to easily achieve perfect results every time. The method and processes were developed as a solution for fussy owners to help dramatically reduce swirls (micro scratches) and spider-webbing caused by sometimes incorrect washing techniques and materials.

Instructions

Glass Cleaning

  • Spray a couple on pumps of Optic onto a Final Inspection step 1 (dark green) glass cloth and wipe area until clean.
  • Follow immediately with a completely dry Final Inspection Step 2 (light green) glass cloth and wipe until almost dry
  • Allow a small amount of product to evaporate to a streak-free finish.

Interior Cleaning

  • You should always thoroughly vaccuum carpets and cloth seats before cleaning with Interior Cleanse.
  • Keep a bucket of lukewarm water next to the car with you so that it is easy to reach.
  • Wet the Interior Nanofibre Cloth, and then wring it out so that it is only lightly damp, and not dripping
  • Fold the cloth into a usable size. If you fold it in half 3 times that should be about right.
  • Spray 2 sprays of Interior cleanse onto the cloth, and then use elbow-grease as required, cleaning one small section (say 50cm x 50cm) at a time.
  • After each section, thoroughly rinse the cloth in the bucket of water, then refold, apply Interior Cleanse, and complete the next small section.
  • You might break a front seat into 3 or 4 sections, cleaning one at a time, and rinsing the cloth between each section.
  • After you have finished one seat, empty the bucket (it will be dirty!), refill with fresh water, and then quickly wipe down the completed seat to remove any residue before moveing onto the next seat, or the dashboard etc.

Applying Vanilla

Apply FI vanilla to your personal taste. Suggested usage is one spray into the carpet of each footwell.

Glass System

The Final Inspection Glass System™, a revolutionary new way to easily and quickly clean glass including tinted glass without chemical and without streaks, smears or smudges.

All new for 2014, the NanoFibre™ Glass System™ is the best tool for glass maintenance.

Clean glass is part of a safe and comfortable driving experience and it is important to have clean glass constantly. Maintaining glass should be simple and easy and the Glass System makes this so

With it's generously sized components, these tailored cloths will gently but effectively and efficiently remove weekly build-up of temporary contaminants from your vehicles glass surfaces without chemical.

Why NanoFibre?

The NanoFibre cloths deep clean and remove oils and dirt from the glass surface, leaving nothing to cause streaks or smears.

Performance, direction of use and glass cleaning information

The Glass System consists of two cloths, a Step 1 and a Step 2.

Step 1 is a Dark Green coloured absorbent cloth used first, slightly damp, to deep clean glass by removing oils and dirt, pulling them away from the surface.

Step 2 is a LIGHT GREEN tightly woven cloth used to remove any residual water on the glass surface and deliver a smear free finish.

The best way to clean glass is to remove materials from the surface, not add to the surface, thus, using glass cleaning chemicals is only recommended if your glass is heavily soiled and/or the debris requires some chemical to assist to break down the debris.

Smearing occurs as a result of material left on the surface, it is vital to use the best, most absorbent cloth to remove all materials from the glass surface in order to achieve the highest clarity and transmission without any ghosting or smearing from thin deposits left on the glass surface. It is also important to use a dry, tight woven cloth for finishing to atomise water and encourage evaporation of very small water particles to avoid visible watermarks.

Deluxe Car-Wash Kit

Why do I need this kit?

Out of all of the different aspects of car detailing, the most important by a long way is washing. That may surprise you. Afterall, everyone knows how to wash a car, right? Unfortunately, that is not the case.

Next time you are walking through a car park on a sunny day, look at the sun's reflection in the bonnets of some of the cars there. On most cars, you will notice 'swirl' marks all over the paint. They are far more noticeable on dark cars than on white or silver cars. These swirls are actually very small scratches all over the paint, and they are caused by one main culprit: Incorrect Washing Technique. As you can see, all of those swirls scatter the light everywhere, which makes the paintwork look dull and old. They can only be removed through intensive polishing. Using this kit, and the washing method below is the best way that we know how to prevent swirls in paintwork for as long as possible. We use exactly this technique in-house

What's included in the kit?

1 x Nanofibre Paintwork Cloth: Used exclusively for wiping product from paintwork. Do not use these cloths for anything else. These clothes have a hard side and a soft side, we only ever use the soft side. These clothes are best used folded into 4, with 2 soft sides showing

2 x Nanofibre Wash Mitt: Used to wash the car. Use only on paint, plastics and glass, but do not use on wheels, unless you keep one exclusively for that purpose

The harsh reality

Every second of every day, dust in the air is landing on your car. Even if it is parked under cover, dust is landing on it. Even seconds after washing your car, dust is landing on it.

Every time you touch your car with your fingers, or your brush along side the car with your clothes, you are grinding very fine pieces of dust and dirt into the paint, and that causes many very tiny scratches. Over time, these scratches become the swirls that you see in so many cars.

It is impossible to avoid swirls completely, for example when you wash the car you need to touch it, and that in itself will cause swirls. All you can do is minimise the swirls by avoiding touching the paint unless absolutely necessary, and then only doing so with the finest nanofibre cloths.

It follows then that to keep swirls and scratches at bay, you need to do everything you can to prevent grinding dust into the paint. The purpose of this kit is to allow you to do exactly that.

Washing Instructions

Clean Wheel Arches

It is a good idea to regularly clean your Wheel Arches to stop build up of dirt on these plastics (or sound deadening fabric on some models)

Rinse Wheels & Wheel Arches to reduce the temperature of the surfaces.

Spray General Purpose Cleaner onto these plastics or fabric as well as your tyres to remove and stop build up of old Tyre Dressing.

Agitate if necessary. Rinse clean when you are hosing down the car later.

Clean Wheels and Tyres

Final Inspection's Power Wheel Clean (PWC) is probably the best wheel cleaner on the planet today. It is almost pH Neutral, and so it is very gentle on painted and polished wheels, and yet it makes very short work indeed of brake dust.

For normal brake dust build-up over a week or 2, all you need to do is spray some PWC onto the wheels, wait a few minutes, and then hose it off. PWC is very effective at dissolving the brake dust and 99% of it will be removed when rinsing the wheel.

NOTE: It is very easy to spray “down” at the wheel only, don't forget to spray up and from side to side as well, to ensure that you get PWC into all nooks and crannies.

For brake dust that is old and cooked on, or to clean the insides of the wheels, use the supplied Wheel Brush to agitate the PWC on the wheel before hosing off.

Rinse wheels and tyres thoroughly when you rinse down the car.

Initial Rinse

The aim of Rinsing the car first is to simply remove as much of the dirt as is possible before we physically touch the car, thereby minimising scratches and swirls.

Set up everything ready to go, make sure that the high pressure washer is connected up and turned on.

Make sure that you have cleaned the wheels, tyres and arches first.

Rinse the whole car from top to bottom with the high pressure washer. Take your time, hold the nozzle about 15 – 20 cm from the paint, don't go too much closer though. Don't forget to do up under the wheel arches, and under the sills all around the car. Give the wheels and tyres a very good rinse to remove the PWC and all of the brake dust that it loosened up.

Washing the Paintwork

As was stressed earlier, swirls cannot be completely avoided, all we can do is be diligent and take care when washing the car to minimise the harm. The Two golden rules you need to follow are:

  1. Only use the Three Premium Final Inspection Nano-fibre cloths to touch the paintwork on your car. Specifcally, that includes the Wash Mitts, the Waffle Weave Drying Towel, and the Paintwork Nanofibre cloths. You should avoid contact with your cars paint with anything other than those three products.
  2. Use the Two Bucket Method to wash your car. In a nutshell, fill both buckets with fresh clean water, and then nominate one as the 'fresh water' bucket, and the other as the 'rinse' bucket. To wash a panel, pick up some fresh water in the Wash Mitt from fresh water bucket, and spray 1 or 2 sprays of PPBS directly onto the Wash Mitt. After you have washed the panel, thoroughly rinse the wash mitt in the rinse bucket to remove all of the dirt from the mitt, wring it out, and then pick up fresh water from the fresh water bucket to wash the next panel. After washing the car, the rinse bucket should be dirty, but the wash bucket should be perfectly clean.

There are 2 Mitts included in this kit, you should use both to wash the car. Do half the car with one, and half the car with the other. This just prevents one Wash Mitt from becoming too dirty

You should always work from top to bottom, and from the cleanest to the dirtiest places. No point in picking up the dirt from behind the wheel arches, and then smearing it all over the bonnet and causing swirls!

  1. Using the first Wash Mitt, wash the Turret (ie the roof, pillars and glass), starting with the paint, finishing with the glass, and then wash the Bonnet, Boot, Back and finally the front of the car IN THAT ORDER! (cleanest to dirtiest)
  2. Using the second Wash Mitt,Wash the sides of the car. Wash the top half of one side first, then the top half of the other side, and then do the lower halves, and again in that order

The method is simple. Start with a clean wash mitt, and put it into the fresh water bucket to pick up fresh water. Spray 1 or 2 sprays (about 2ml) of PPBS (Paint Pampering Body Shampoo) onto the Wash Mott, and wash one panel or less. Do not scrub, do not apply pressure, do not use circular motions, and do not overlap your strokes, you only need to touch each piece of paint once! So simply wipe over back and forth. Each panel should take in the order of 5 to 10 seconds. If you find that dirt is stuck on and cannot be removed that easily, then this is a good indication that you need more wax!

After you have completed each panel (or part panel), rinse the wash mitt out in the rinse bucket thoroughly, wring it out, and then pick up fresh clean water from the fresh water bucket and do the next panel. If you are using more than one mitt to wash the car, swap mitts after each section

Final Rinse

Don't be fooled, there is still a fair amount of dirt on your car, it is caught up in the emulsion formed with the shampoo. The purpose of this final rinse is to remove the leftover shampoo (and all of the dirt that it has trapped) form the car. Rinse down the panels from top to bottom, but pay special attention to nooks, crannies, panel gaps etc, as they will be full of shampoo (and therefore dirt).

Drying the car

Use the WWDT (Final Inspection Waffle Weave Drying Towel) to dry the car. Fold the towel into eight (so you have 16 clean sides to use) and basically use one side to dry each panel. If the towel gets water-logged, simply ring it out. Be careful about letting any parts of the towel touch the ground, especially when you are drying the bottom parts of the car, as this will just pick up dirt that you will then grind into your paint. Only dry your paint and trim with the WWDT, not the wheels

Finishing the wheels

Use the supplied Wheel Nanofibre Cloth and a little Gloss Boost sprayed onto the wheel to quickly go over each wheel and remove all traces of brake dust. Make sure that you get into all the nooks and crannies, and get down low and look up so you can see all the bits you missed from looking from above. You should have removed 99% of all brake dust earlier, this last step is essentially to pick up the last 1% and dry the wheels

Door Jambs

This is probably the most commonly overlooked part of washing your car, clean door jambs make all of the difference in the perception of how clean the car is. Also, if there is dirt caught in the jambs, it will come out after you have finished washing the car and leave dirt trails everywhere!

Simply spray a little Gloss Boost onto the Jamb Cloth and wipe the dirt and grease from all of the door jambs, and of course the inside painted areas of your doors. Don't forget to do the bonnet, boot and fuel flap as well, they all trap dirt!

Apply Gloss Boost

If you want your freshly washed car to have a little extra sparkle and 'pop', then simply spend another 5 minutes and go over the whole car from top to bottom using Final Inspection Gloss Boost, and a Microfibre Paint Cloth.

Fold the Microfibre cloth into 4. We only ever use the plush side of the cloth on the paint, never the 'hard' side. If you fold the cloth into 4, so that you have 2 plush sides on the outside, use one side as the 'wet side' and the other as the 'dry side'

Simply spray a very small amount of Gloss Boost onto a panel (Very Important: Less is more here, you only need just one or two sprays and no more!) and then spread it over the panel evenly using the wet side of the cloth. Don't scrub! Don't apply any pressure! You are simply spreading the Gloss Boost evenly! Then, straight away, turn the cloth over and buff the panel dry with the dry side. Repeat this process over the whole car.

Spending 5 minutes to apply Gloss Boost to your car after washing will really add another dimension to how shiny your car will look.

Final Inspection backing plate sizes and pad suitability

  • 75mm backing plates suitable for pads 90mm - 125mm diameter
  • 125mm backing plates suitable for pads 135mm - 150mm diameter
  • 175mm backing plates suitable for pads 200mm+ diameter

It is recommended to recess backing plates from pad edges by a minimum of 10mm and no more than 50mm, i.e. it is not recommended to use a 75mm backing plate with a 135mm pad as the diameter of the pad exceeds the diameter of the backing plate by more than 50mm making it difficult to properly centre and providing insufficient grip.

Active backing plate

  • Active backing plates are more forgiving in the sense that they will compensate for lift irregularities as a result of operator movements.
  • Active backing plates are recommended for polishing on curvy panels and for amateur operators who may tend to lift pads from the surface using only the edges of the pad, a tilted pad usually results in hologramming.
  • The active backing plate compensates by absorbing some of the pressure and maintaining a flat pad which dramatically reduces hologramming and increases polish efficiency.

Rigid backing plates

  • Rigid backing plates are considered the professional option, they require a higher skill level and are less forgiving to incorrect technique by the operator.
  • Final Inspection rigid backing plates also have a significantly lower profile than an active backing plate which may assist polishing in cumbersome areas.
  • Final Inspection rigid backing plates weigh less, are cheaper and are slightly more durable than their active versions.

Decontamination Clay Kit

Why do I need this kit?

One of the most important parts of detailing, and often overlooked, is the use of a Clay Bar.

Every day, there are contaminants in the air that land on your car and bond hard, so that even washing won't remove them.

Examples of this: Someone might be mixing cement 2 blocks away, and that dust gets picked up in the wind and dumped on yur car. Someone else might be spray-painting his back fence etc.

Don't believe me? Next time you have finished washing your car, gently run the back of your finger across the surface of the paint. Chances are, it will feel quite rough. This is just those contaminants that have bonded to the paint

Using a Clay Bar, along with Clay Lube, is a simple and very effective way of removing those surface contaminants to leave the paintwork smooth like glass.

Please note: Using a clay bar can leave some very fine marring on the paint. For this reason, we only ever use a Clay Bar immediately before Polishing the car.

What's included in the kit?

1 x Clay Bar Twin Pack: 2 bars of Final Inspection Extra Fine Clay

1 x Clay Lube 500ml: An excellent lubricator for Clay

1 x Paintwork Nanofibre Cloth: The ONLY cloth we use for working with the cars paint.

Instructions

  • Only ever use half a clay bar at a time, and pack the rest up and put it away.
  • If you drop the clay bar on the ground, you are better off throwing that bit away, otherwise the dirt that it has paked up will scratch the paint
  • Flatten the clay bar out into a small pancake, approx 6cm across
  • Spray a little Clay Lube onto the paint surface, and gently move the Clay Bar back and forth smoothly over the surface.
  • Use your finger tips, and feel what the clay is doing. You will be able to feel when it is grabbing at the contaminants on the paint, and then feel it glide smoothly over the surface once the contaminants have been removed
  • Just keep adding Clay Lube as required to keep the clay bar gliding over the surface. After you have completed a whole panel, wipe the used Clay Lube from the panel with the supplied Paintwork Nanofibre Cloth

Leather Care Kit

Why do I need this kit?

There is nothing like clean new leather in a car, it smells great, feels smooth and clean, and is very luxurious.

Leather is a natural material, and if not looked after, it will wrinkle, crack, split and peel. It needs to be kept clean, and most importantly, it needs to be moisturised (or fed) to keep it soft and supple.

One aspect of Leather Care that is often overlooked is the stitching! Dirt can build up in the stitching, and the sharp edges of the dirt will gradually cut through the sticthing over time as you move around on the seat.

Before cleaning, use a gentle brush to brush the dirt from the stitching, and vaccuum as you go. Then, when applying Leather Feed, make sure that you get plenty into the stitching, it will lubricate it so that the dirt will not be able to cut into it

Leather Cleaning

  • You should always thoroughly vaccuum Leather seats before cleaning
  • Keep a bucket of lukewarm water next to the car with you so that it is easy to reach.
  • Wet the Interior Nanofibre Cloth, and then wring it out so that it is only lightly damp, and not dripping
  • Fold the cloth into a usable size. If you fold it in half 3 times that should be about right.
  • Apply one squirt of Leather Clean Gel onto the cloth, and then use elbow-grease as required, cleaning one small section (say 50cm x 50cm) at a time.
  • After each section, thoroughly rinse the cloth in the bucket of water, then refold, apply Leather Clean Gel, and complete the next small section.
  • You might break a front seat into 3 or 4 sections, cleaning one at a time, and rinsing the cloth between each section.
  • After you have finished one seat, empty the bucket (it will be dirty!), refill with fresh water, and then quickly wipe down the completed seat to remove any residue before moveing onto the next seat.
  • Allow Leather to dry

Leather Feeding

  • Apply one squirt of Leather Feed to the Hand Pocket Applicator (HPA)
  • Wipe product evenly over the surface, using more product as needed
  • It is important to get Leather Feed deep into the stitching, it lubricates it and prevents wear.
  • If the Leather is dry, it will soak up all of the Leather Feed. Reapply until you are left with a glossy, even surface
  • Re-apply Leather Feed every month or so

The harsh reality

Every second of every day, dust in the air is landing on your car. Even if it is parked under cover, dust is landing on it. Even seconds after washing your car, dust is landing on it.

Every time you touch your car with your fingers, or your brush along side the car with your clothes, you are grinding very fine pieces of dust and dirt into the paint, and that causes many very tiny scratches. Over time, these scratches become the swirls that you see in so many cars.

It is impossible to avoid swirls completely, for example when you wash the car you need to touch it, and that in itself will cause swirls. All you can do is minimise the swirls by avoiding touching the paint unless absolutely necessary, and then only doing so with the finest nanofibre cloths.

It follows then that to keep swirls and scratches at bay, you need to do everything you can to prevent grinding dust into the paint. The purpose of this kit is to allow you to do exactly that.

Washing Instructions

Clean Wheels and Tyres

Final Inspection's Power Wheel Clean (PWC) is probably the best wheel cleaner on the planet today. It is almost pH Neutral, and so it is very gentle on painted and polished wheels, and yet it makes very short work indeed of brake dust.

For normal brake dust build-up over a week or 2, all you need to do is spray some PWC onto the wheels, wait a few minutes, and then hose it off. PWC is very effective at dissolving the brake dust and 99% of it will be removed when rinsing the wheel.

NOTE: It is very easy to spray “down” at the wheel only, don't forget to spray up and from side to side as well, to ensure that you get PWC into all nooks and crannies.

Rinse wheels and tyres thoroughly when you rinse down the car.

Initial Rinse

The aim of Rinsing the car first is to simply remove as much of the dirt as is possible before we physically touch the car, thereby minimising scratches and swirls.

Set up everything ready to go, make sure that the high pressure washer is connected up and turned on.

Make sure that you have cleaned the wheels, tyres and arches first.

Rinse the whole car from top to bottom with the high pressure washer. Take your time, hold the nozzle about 15 – 20 cm from the paint, don't go too much closer though. Don't forget to do up under the wheel arches, and under the sills all around the car. Give the wheels and tyres a very good rinse to remove the PWC and all of the brake dust that it loosened up.

Washing the Paintwork

As was stressed earlier, swirls cannot be completely avoided, all we can do is be diligent and take care when washing the car to minimise the harm. The Two golden rules you need to follow are:

  1. Only use the Three Premium Final Inspection Nano-fibre cloths to touch the paintwork on your car. Specifcally, that includes the Wash Mitts, the Waffle Weave Drying Towel, and the Paintwork Nanofibre cloths. You should avoid contact with your cars paint with anything other than those three products.
  2. Use the Two Bucket Method to wash your car. In a nutshell, fill both buckets with fresh clean water, and then nominate one as the 'fresh water' bucket, and the other as the 'rinse' bucket. To wash a panel, pick up some fresh water in the Wash Mitt from fresh water bucket, and spray 1 or 2 sprays of PPBS directly onto the Wash Mitt. After you have washed the panel, thoroughly rinse the wash mitt in the rinse bucket to remove all of the dirt from the mitt, wring it out, and then pick up fresh water from the fresh water bucket to wash the next panel. After washing the car, the rinse bucket should be dirty, but the wash bucket should be perfectly clean.

You should always work from top to bottom, and from the cleanest to the dirtiest places. No point in picking up the dirt from behind the wheel arches, and then smearing it all over the bonnet and causing swirls!

  1. Wash the Turret (ie the roof, pillars and glass), starting with the paint, finishing with the glass, and then wash the Bonnet, Boot, Back and finally the front of the car IN THAT ORDER! (cleanest to dirtiest)
  2. Wash the sides of the car. Wash the top half of one side first, then the top half of the other side, and then do the lower halves, and again in that order

The method is simple. Start with a clean wash mitt, and put it into the fresh water bucket to pick up fresh water. Spray 1 or 2 sprays (about 2ml) of PPBS (Paint Pampering Body Shampoo) onto the Wash Mott, and wash one panel or less. Do not scrub, do not apply pressure, do not use circular motions, and do not overlap your strokes, you only need to touch each piece of paint once! So simply wipe over back and forth. Each panel should take in the order of 5 to 10 seconds. If you find that dirt is stuck on and cannot be removed that easily, then this is a good indication that you need more wax!

After you have completed each panel (or part panel), rinse the wash mitt out in the rinse bucket thoroughly, wring it out, and then pick up fresh clean water from the fresh water bucket and do the next panel. If you are using more than one mitt to wash the car, swap mitts after each section

Final Rinse

Don't be fooled, there is still a fair amount of dirt on your car, it is caught up in the emulsion formed with the shampoo. The purpose of this final rinse is to remove the leftover shampoo (and all of the dirt that it has trapped) form the car. Rinse down the panels from top to bottom, but pay special attention to nooks, crannies, panel gaps etc, as they will be full of shampoo (and therefore dirt).

Drying the car

Use the WWDT (Final Inspection Waffle Weave Drying Towel) to dry the car. Fold the towel into eight (so you have 16 clean sides to use) and basically use one side to dry each panel. If the towel gets water-logged, simply ring it out. Be careful about letting any parts of the towel touch the ground, especially when you are drying the bottom parts of the car, as this will just pick up dirt that you will then grind into your paint. Only dry your paint and trim with the WWDT, not the wheels

Finishing the wheels

Use the supplied Wheel Nanofibre Cloth and a little Gloss Boost sprayed onto the wheel to quickly go over each wheel and remove all traces of brake dust. Make sure that you get into all the nooks and crannies, and get down low and look up so you can see all the bits you missed from looking from above. You should have removed 99% of all brake dust earlier, this last step is essentially to pick up the last 1% and dry the wheels

Apply Gloss Boost

If you want your freshly washed car to have a little extra sparkle and 'pop', then simply spend another 5 minutes and go over the whole car from top to bottom using Final Inspection Gloss Boost, and a Microfibre Paint Cloth.

Fold the Microfibre cloth into 4. We only ever use the plush side of the cloth on the paint, never the 'hard' side. If you fold the cloth into 4, so that you have 2 plush sides on the outside, use one side as the 'wet side' and the other as the 'dry side'

Simply spray a very small amount of Gloss Boost onto a panel (Very Important: Less is more here, you only need just one or two sprays and no more!) and then spread it over the panel evenly using the wet side of the cloth. Don't scrub! Don't apply any pressure! You are simply spreading the Gloss Boost evenly! Then, straight away, turn the cloth over and buff the panel dry with the dry side. Repeat this process over the whole car.

Spending 5 minutes to apply Gloss Boost to your car after washing will really add another dimension to how shiny your car will look.

Why do I need this kit?

This kit contains everything you need to keep your car's paint protected and looking good for years. When used in conjunction with our recommended washing technique, this kit will help you keep the paint swirl and blemish free. What's more, it takes no more than 5 minutes after you have washed your car!

Every car should have a protective layer of wax on it at all times. Doing so gives you the following benefits:

  • It protects your paintwork from the acids in Bird Poo, which would otherwise easily etch into the paint.
  • It protects your paintwork from UV radiation, which would otherwise burn your clear coat, and leave it brittle, and subject to cracking and peeling.
  • It keeps your car looking clean for longer. People often claim that dark cars are harder to keep clean, but that is only true if wax is not used. With adequate wax protection, dirt will find it much harder to stick to the surface, and most of it will wash off in the rain, so your car looks cleaner for longer

The primary reason that people don't keep wax protection on their cars is that it takes too long to apply. That certainly USED to be the case, but with the latest Final Inspection products, that problem has been solved. A layer of wax can be applied in as little as 5 minutes!

When do I use this kit?

This kit is only to be used immediately after washing your car, and not at any other time*.

For argument's sake, lets say that you wash your car every fortnight, or 26 times in a year. For the first 3 washes, apply a layer of Full Metal Jacket Spray Wax. So after the first 3 washes, you will have 3 strong layers of wax to protect your paint. You won't need to reapply FMJSW now until the water beads start to flatten out, anywhere from 6 to 12 months away.

On the washes where you are not applying FMJSW, apply Gloss Boost instead. It gives your car an awesome gloss coating that looks brilliant in the sun, but adds very little protection on its own.

What's included in the kit?

2 x Paintwork Nanofibre Cloths: The Paintwork Nanofibre Cloth has a hard side and a soft side. NEVER use the hard side, we only ever use the soft side to touch paintwork. Fold the cloth into 4 so that you have 2 soft sides. If you fold the other way, you have 2 fresh soft sides. Cloths can be washed in the washing machine on the Synthetics cycle (preferably with a microfibre wash) and will last for many years if looked after.

1 x Full Metal Jacket Spray Wax 275ml: One of the best spray-waxes on the market today. Application is a simple 5 minute process, and will provide protection to your car's paint for months at a time. Provides essential protection againt bird-poo and UV radiation, and adds a nice gloss finish. It can be used on paint, glass (not windscreen) rubber and plastic.

1 x Gloss Boost 500ml: This product offers very little protection to your paint, it's primary purpose is to add Gloss, which it does very well. Used in conjunction with FMJ Spray Wax, it makes a formidible team.

So are you gonna tell me how to use it, or what?

PLEASE NOTE: As with all Final Inspection products, a little goes a very long way. Most people believe that if a little bit does a good job, then more must be better, but this is not the case with FI products, they are designed to be used sparingly. Using too much will make the products more difficult to use. If you are finding it difficult to buff off either of the products in this kit, then you are using too much product! Try using half that amount.

After every wash, spend just 5 minutes to apply a layer of either FMJSW, or Gloss Boost, but never both. FMJSW only needs to be used the first 3 times, or when more wax is required, and Gloss Boost is applied on every wash where FMJSW is not applied.

Both products are applied in exactly the same way:

  1. Fold the Paintwork Nanofibre Cloth into 4, so that you have 2 soft sides. Nominally, one side will be the 'dry' side, and the other side will be the 'Wet' side.
  2. Spray a little product directly onto a panel. One or 2 sprays is all that it takes per panel, if you use too much it will be hard to buff off later.
  3. Use the 'Wet' side of the cloth to spread the product evenly over the panel. This side of the cloth will now be Wet!
  4. Flip the cloth over and buff the surface clean with the 'Dry' side of the cloth.
  5. Repeat for every panel

Once you have done this a couple of times and figured out how little product to use, you will be able to do the whole car in around 5 minutes every time.

*You can use a little Gloss Boost and Paintwork Nanofibre Cloth to remove Bird-Poo as soon as possible. Be careful though, as it is very easy to add swirls doing this, so try to touch the paint as little as possible.
